image.altText: Two small boats with people in uniform in the foreground and a large ship with a crane on it in the background.

props.synopsis: Senior defence force personnel cancelled a fatigue study for a regiment that later lost four airmen in a helicopter crash, an inquiry has heard.

title.children: Defence personnel cancelled regiment fatigue study before four men were killed in Taipan crash, inquiry hears

image.altText: A girl in a blue school uniform types on a laptop.

props.synopsis: A Queensland tribunal has found a school didn't discriminate against a school student by requiring females to wear skirts to formal school occasions.

title.children: Queensland student loses discrimination case over school's uniform policy on skirts

image.altText: Oakdale Guest House fire

props.synopsis: Cold case detectives have announced a $500,000 reward for information over a fire at an Ipswich guest house that claimed the lives of five men more than 30 years ago.

title.children: Cold case detectives announce $500,000 reward over 1990 fire that killed five men west of Brisbane

image.altText: Anonymous woman lies in a bed with heart rate monitor clipped on finger at the Marie Stopes clinic in Melbourne.

props.synopsis: Abortion has become a surprise subject of debate in the Queensland election – putting an issue that many Australians might have thought was settled, back on the national agenda.

title.children: Abortion has been legal in Queensland since 2018. Why is it suddenly a subject for debate?

image.altText: Two men in a hazmat suit investigating a crime

props.synopsis: Police say a 72-year-old man, believed to be known to Skye Sampson, 32, was found unconscious and not breathing at the property.

title.children: Woman charged with murder after elderly man's death south of Brisbane

image.altText: An older man works on an artwork as a younger, smiling woman watches on.

props.synopsis: More Australians are being diagnosed with dementia and those in cognitive decline can feel frustrated and lonely, but on the Gold Coast an increasing number are finding ways to enjoy themselves.

title.children: How art and music are putting smiles on the faces of people with Australia's second-deadliest disease

image.altText: A homeless person sits near a cluster of tents in front of a sculpture of the Olympic rings.

props.synopsis: Brisbane risks ending up with a homelessness crisis similar to that seen during the Paris Games unless it rapidly addresses its social housing shortage, researchers say.

title.children: Paris kicked out its homeless people during the Olympics. Is Brisbane heading in the same direction?

image.altText: A man standing on a bitumen street wearing a button up shirt and large hat, he has a serious expression on his face

props.synopsis: With both Labor and the LNP based in Brisbane, minor parties and independents are well placed to win over disenfranchised regional voters at the upcoming Queensland election.

title.children: A bushman, Pauline Hanson's right-hand man, and the 'mother of teals' eye voter frustration

image.altText: A small fish on the palm of a hand.

props.synopsis: Conservationists believe harvesting the invasive fish tilapia and turning it into fertiliser could help save one of Queensland's most scientifically important ecosystems.

title.children: River pest could become plant food under plan to protect ancient species

image.altText: Woman watching over ICU crib, looking at her baby sleeping.

props.synopsis: Families face an expensive legal battle to prove medical negligence in Australia, but experts say reforms that New Zealand undertook two decades ago offer a solution.

title.children: Australian patients have a hard time proving medical negligence, but in NZ it's a different story

image.altText: A group of reporters stand together in front of a banner.

props.synopsis: From news, analysis and explainers through to election previews, key electorates and candidates, Queensland Votes has the latest on the upcoming state election. Click through to read more.

title.children: Queensland Votes 2024 — read, watch and listen to the latest election news and analysis

image.altText: A card saying David and flowers with a police car in the background.

props.synopsis: The accused's lawyers told the jury it was not in dispute that the teenager had stabbed Mr Connolly and caused his death but asked the jury to "keep an open mind" during the trial.

title.children: Teenager accused of murdering Brisbane man with 41-centimetre knife pleads not guilty

image.altText: Back of grey-haired woman's head at desk with computer screen and take-away coffee cup

props.synopsis: Police are investigating after a 60-year-old Cairns woman lost more than $200,000 in an online scam. The scammer claimed he worked in the military overseas and eventually asked her for money.

title.children: 60yo woman loses $200k after making 'many' payments to man in online romance scam

image.altText: A man sits on a rock

props.synopsis: A Queensland coroner has recommended research into "victim-precipitated homicide" be undertaken following a fatal police shooting at Airlie Beach in the state's north.

title.children: Airlie Beach police shooting victim dared police to shoot him, inquest told

image.altText: Jordan Bos runs with the ball between two Japan players

props.synopsis: The Socceroos have never beaten Japan on their home turf, and face an uphill battle to do so in Saitama in Tony Popovic's second game in charge. Follow live.

title.children: Socceroos take unlikely lead against Japan in Saitama

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Half-time: Socceroos hanging on against Japan

image.altText: Declan Fraser buckles his helmet

props.synopsis: Declan Fraser was preparing to drive at breakneck speeds around Australia's most famous racetrack when fire engulfed his Gold Coast home, destroying everything.

title.children: Supercar driver left only with 'clothes on his back' after home burns down while racing Bathurst

image.altText: Two men at a table with a crowd of people behind them

props.synopsis: Stuart McCullough was paid almost $500,000 from the taxpayer and farmer-funded Australian Wool Innovation organisation to leave his job. WoolProducers has questioned the payout as farmers do it "exceptionally tough".

title.children: Former ag boss receives $480k payout to leave job as farmers do it 'exceptionally tough'

image.altText: An American saltwater crocodile opens its mouth underwater.

props.synopsis: Crocodiles are on the move across Queensland and there is concern people are putting themselves in mortal danger.

title.children: Authorities work to debunk myths amid crackdown on reckless behaviour around crocodiles

image.altText: A woman's hands holding a mobile phone.

props.synopsis: Viral social media groups naming and shaming men on dating apps are being paused or shut down after a separate defamation case cost a Facebook administrator thousands in legal fees.

title.children: Sis, Are We Dating The Same Guy? Facebook groups paused as admins fear legal risks

image.altText: A boy and a woman hugging on the beach

props.synopsis: In the lead-up to the state election, there have been renewed calls for a new high school to cater for the population boom along the Bundaberg coast.

title.children: These seaside towns are perfect for families — except they're missing one thing

image.altText: Two small boats with divers abroad approach a large underwater shipwreck

props.synopsis: New Zealand's defence minister has dismissed calls for an apology, saying the NZ Defence Force was "deeply traumatised" by the sinking of HMNZS Manawanui.

title.children: 'Nothing but sadness' in the village near where a NZ Navy ship sank as locals lose livelihoods

image.altText: People watch a TV screen with smoke rising out of a forest area.

props.synopsis: North Korea blows up the north section of unused roads once linked to the South, with the rivals exchanging threats days after the North claimed that its rival flew drones over its capital, Pyongyang.

title.children: North Korea blows up parts of inter-Korean roads and rails

image.altText: a collage of two premiers, a former female premier on the left and a current male on the right

props.synopsis: Former Queensland premier Peter Beattie is saying out loud what is plainly obvious: Steven Miles had a very small runway in the lead-up to this election.

title.children: Labor heavyweight says Annastacia Palaszczuk left Steven Miles with a tough task

image.altText: The sign in front of Longreach Station.

props.synopsis: A 24-year-old woman was sleeping in a dormitory building at the former college campus when her dog alerted her to a major fire.

title.children: Young woman escapes fire at former pastoral college after dog wakes her up

image.altText: Voters at polling booths in Canberra in October 2016.

props.synopsis: Anyone can visit an early voting booth if they want to cast their ballot before October 26 — and if you'd rather vote by post, today is the last day to apply.

title.children: Early voting in the Queensland election begins today. Here's what you need to know

image.altText: A woman in an akubra poses with her black-and-white dog, in front of a ute with a harness strapped to the back.

props.synopsis: The century-old organisation is baking-in its connection to the internet to woo new members from the outskirts of Brisbane, the remote north, and even on the other side of the world.

title.children: Bronc champ Emily is the kind of young go-getter the CWA is hoping to lure

image.altText: a woman next to a sign

props.synopsis: Youth crime rates have plummeted in Queensland despite claims from both major parties that the state is in the grip of a crisis.

title.children: Australia's youth crime rates have plummeted despite what politicians would have you believe

image.altText: A piece of rusted metal laying on the sand at a tropical beach

props.synopsis: A 45-year-old inventor has bought a sought-after beachfront property, vowing to clear it of debris and rogue four-wheel drivers. But Labor has threatened to compulsorily acquire the land and it's taking that position to an election.

title.children: This coastal headland has just been sold to a private buyer. Could the Queensland government take it from him?

image.altText: four open lunch boxes with fruit and packets of snacks

props.synopsis: Queensland Premier Steven Miles is vowing to make school lunches free for every student in prep through to Year 6, if Labor is re-elected at the October 26 election.

title.children: Queensland Labor promises free lunches for state school students, if re-elected

image.altText: Steven Miles poses for a selfie with a woman who holds up her phone towards them.

props.synopsis: As Steven Miles leads his party to the October 26 election, he's set out to put his own stamp on the government.

title.children: Steven Miles is fighting the election campaign in the shadows of his predecessor, but he's determined to carve his own path

image.altText: A woman pointing to the air in parliament.

props.synopsis: Labor's lone seat inside of a Liberal National Party stronghold could be one of the most hotly-contested electorates in Queensland's state election.

title.children: Australia's youngest housing minister could lose her seat to a cleanskin who 'can't be blamed for LNP failures'

image.altText: people lining up outside a church

props.synopsis: The Queensland election campaign began on October 1 but the fight against misinformation began far earlier.

title.children: Electoral commission warns of falsehoods, mistruths that could sway Queensland poll

image.altText: A picture of three people, a boy and two women in a kitchen

props.synopsis: In a little clubhouse kitchen in Brisbane's suburban south, everyone has a story to tell — all are displaced Ukrainians who have fled the war and sought refuge in Australia.

title.children: Brisbane restaurant gives displaced Ukrainians a job and a second home
